title: Please Dont Over buff Kayn , the ult buff on shadow assassin is more than enough
body:
I just dont want to see such balanced champion receive a buff that will eventually require another nerf that will put him in a worst state that he wasnt in before , i dont want kayn to get the taliyah treatement when she was released , hes completly fine right now (i bet he'll be even better in 7.15) but there is absolutely no need to buff him more than what he had this patch , i just want to learn the champion and get rewarded for learning his kit , please riot just leave him be for now.

Thank you :)

It takes forever to get into a game, and then the game will still always be imbalanced skill-wise.  Almost always a stomp and people don't try 'cause "it's _just_ Pbe"

Ohh, THAT's what you meant.

Yeah, the thing is that they get their balance tweak data mostly from Ranked, not normals.  People don't try as hard in normals and their hardcore playerbase (those who have played for years) play a lot of ranked compared to normals.  We'd just be waiting an extra patch for them to fixed busted stuff.

It'd be more fine tuned though. PBE is only good for detecting feel issues, normals would be for finding big balance problems (think Skarner on juggernaut update), and ranked would be for the final tuning.
I don't want to live with stuff like release Graves or Mord for 2 patches.  No thanks.
Seems like they should let more people in if it takes so long to find a game

I know they are doing maintenance right now on the Pbe application side of things though, so I'm really hoping they have something planned to maybe rotate testers or something so that people take advantage of it fully when they have access to it instead of just sitting on the account until a new champ or a rework they want to try is released.

If it was 1 week on, and 3 off it would be better than they have right now.
They could even limit it with peoples' honour levels if they want to.

There's also the part where Pbe is worldwide (not a bad thing) but the time zones kinda mess with queue times too.
PBE is a shitshow where Chalanger-Bronze 5 players are all put in the same matchmaking.

Don't buff his damage!!!(other then the current changes)

Just give his Q a 50 range increase in shadow form.   This will solve his problem by giving him a bit longer of a engage/escape while leaving him counterplay.

I've been playing Kayn a lot over the past two weeks and I've managed to get Rank 7 Mastery on him. In my personal opinion, Shadow Assassin Kayn probably still won't see much play even after the buff to Umbral Trespass' AD ratio. He'll probably also still be a bit on the weak side as well. Shadow Assassin Kayn's kit is very fluid and feels good to play but why would you ever choose to transform into Shadow Assassin Kayn when Rhaast has an abundant amount of sustain, percentage based damage and hard cc built into his kit?

To specify, I don't think this is an issue that stems from Rhaast overshadowing Shadow Assassin Kayn due to a numbers discrepancy (Rhaast is already pretty well-balanced in my opinion). It's an issue with Shadow Assassin Kayn not presenting a high enough incentive for players to choose him over Rhaast. Rhaast is just too reliable in solo queue because you don't have to rely on your teammates to provide cc or sustain for you - you can be a one man show. On the other hand, Shadow Assassin Kayn has a larger burst potential but he's far riskier than Rhaast because he lacks hard cc and sustain which forces players to do the one thing that many of them dislike (relying on their teammates to help them win the game). Other than this feedback, I just wanted to say good job on Kayn, Wav3Break.

https://i.gyazo.com/894e0d91f6017947ff90fb3982c21cd8.png
Obviously he's more reliable... he's a bruiser... assassins are always riskier.

I got kayn to matery 7 also. Played plenty of SA and Rhaast. I found Rhaast to be more reliable as well. SA just could not seem to finish a kill without on an ult without having to q and auto. By that time escaping was so slim. This was the case even when I got some very early kills. Now I played against a SA kayn recently and the difference was night and day. I was adc and trying to farm. He could literally come in and own me in a blink before I could even react. I would see him coming and start running my ass off (even flash) and he still catches me and bloop. So basically he's an assassin. That's the incentive to pick him over Rhaast.

Rhaast seems to be both bruiser and assassin, that W knock up, cancels a {{champion:99}} , and any kind of channel spell.
He is made to PISS YOU OFF.

as previous poster stated...

Rhaast will still be picked over SA unless they remove kayn's knock up W, then, and only then will SA see fair play on both Avatars

I don't agree with the OP. If Kayn is at the lowest winrate in game and is meant to be a carry, there is a serious problem to him. I have been playing a lot of Kayn and can name over 100 times some bug or nonsense killed me for 0 reason. He needs more than an ult buff. I do agree I don't need a hugggge buff, but to leave him with the lowest win rate is too much. Right now unless your 8 kills ahead, shadow form offers nothing. His W can't knock people up, which is why Darkin for is more powerful. He can't heal. Building Crit in assassin form offers little damage for way too long and no cooldowns. Building lethality is the only way to stay relevant and even than you can't duel well. I can go on and on, but I hope your not going to just buff his ult and think that will fix his problems.

I do just fine with Shadow Kayn, the ult buff is more than enough already. The last thing Kayn needs is to get buffed to the point where everyone is banning him or picking him just because he's so good. I just came from a champ (Yasuo) that I can barely play because of pick/ban, I don't want it happening to another.

You can't have carrys who aren't hated. They are meant to hold a team up. It would be like saying soraka is healing too much, ban her. Now soraka is oppressive in her own right as a support who spams he attacks, but she can't fight teams well so she isn't hated. Kayn will be hated no matter what they do. He is an assassin/skirmisher. His role frustrates people and there is no changing that. What Riot needs to do is create a blind pick ranked game where people like us don't have our champions banned because someone is afraid to play us. As a Yasuo main wirht about 1.3million exp I have been playing him for years, even when Yasuo had the lowest winrate in game. I learned to play well, really well, but people blame the champion when you do well, then blame you when you're getting stomped. There is no winning for Carrys m8. So I am not in favor of just keeping him from doing his role just because he scares people.

If ratio buff + draktar bugfix make him too strong (if draktar bug was a permanent bug, that would explain why assassin form struggle that hard in 7.14 and should solve a lot of his problem to assassinate) will you revert the ratio change or change something else instead?

Hey Wav3Break

What if RIOT made the PBE a rotating game mode? open on sunday for like 6-8 hours. This would allow for an actual testing ground rather than a bug detection server.
The same problems would pop up.

However it'd be a much more effective balance testing ground. More players, more games and as a result more data.

Instead of the current "this is a sneak peak of a buggy change that will almost surely go through "

I think they'd be better off designing the new system to rotate the actual playerbase.

Right now you either have Pbe access or you don't.

I'm hoping the new signup and management system will make it possible to have Pbe for a week, then lose access for 3 weeks, then get access again.
Or even if they made it so there is decay or something.
I'd need to keep playing games if I want to keep access and I'd be able to bank games.

Suggestion I have read from another post. Can you guys increase the range on Kayn's Q for shadow form? It would make shadow form more desirable if you gave him some more mobility, and engage, or disengage options.

Rhaast will still get more play because he has a knockup, and I personally play Rhaast for that. Also just in general hes going to get played more cause he looks cooler (although shadow assassin is cool looking).

Woah, woah, woah, @Riot Wav3Break, now I've been playing league for a long time. I've started on a literal toaster that got so warm you could make eggs & bacon on it, League ran perfectly fine on a GT325m. Over the years I've moved onto better things. I am now more or less rocking an i7 4790k + GTX 1070. It hurts to say that I've seen a massive decline in my framerate since last year. I used to be able to pull between 300-400 fps. Now my frame rate hardly sticks around 200 during the early-mid game it begins to drop into the lower 100's. Until at one point went below 80. Now we are talking about the performance on the rift, take ARAM, for example, a similar thing happens where my frame rate just barely hovers around 150. Not to mention the game visibly stutters and hiccups when entering bushes sometimes. I can for sure say that this isn't my computer's problem. It has been rebuilt completely recently, on top of that I do not have such issues with any other game. I think I actually get a higher average frame rate on Warframe now than I do on League. I surely cannot be the only one that has noticed this? League isn't a demanding game, it was designed to run on almost any computer so why are frame-rates tanking so much? I don't suppose reinstalling the game on an SSD would do much, but would possibly be worth a shot. I understand we have had many updates/changes but they should in no way affect performance as they weren't really visual updates. I also anticipate some of you will probably say that having high frames doesn't matter, or that I should be happy to have at least that many. If my frames dip so much on such hardware, I cannot imagine what lower-end users are going through.

I haven't seen a lot of people actually asking for Buffs, just Riot wanting them. So I'm not sure how that makes people sheep. I'm seeing more "Riot is gonna buff him and make him OP aren't they?". While I agree with the first two lines, the last one seems just pointlessly insulting because reasons.
Darkin needs lower % health damage nerfs and scaling buffs in order to draw him away from the tankier builds. And some flat nerf someone where else.

In my opinion, Rhaast is fine just the way he is. His percentage health damage isn't a problem because it's designed to help him handle duels against tanky champions. He still pops carries either way and doesn't get much of a benefit from his Q's percentage based damage because carries are usually squishy. His sustain on his passive _might_ be a bit too high but aside from that, I think Rhaast is pretty well-balanced.

He is except people build a ton of durability items and he than loses a shit ton of his risk. His massive healing, ability to walk through walls, knockup, mobility, and untargetability wouldn't be a problem if he wasn't so effective with tank/y items. 

His kit is mostly fine but his itemization is dumb.

Rhaast's damage scales mostly with his bonus AD and/or total AD, so if you build mostly tanky, then you're not going to do very much damage. Plus, his passive heals him for a percent of the damage that his spells deal, so again, if you build tanky, you're going to lose out on damage _and_ sustain. The only reason he seems a bit overbearing at the moment is because most of the lethality items and Death's Dance are broken. You can say this about most bruisers or fighters though and I don't think Rhaast abuses the current popular builds as well as someone like Fiora or Darius or Renekton or Draven, etc. You get the point.
